intro: Cyrtandromoea nicobarica, commonly known as the Nicobar starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its hairy, slender stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
